required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Aerobic and Strength Training Exercise in Improving Fitness and Arm Health During and After Radiation Therapy in Patients With Stage II-III Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Can Aerobic and Strength Training Exercise Initiated During and Continued After Radiation Therapy for Breast Cancer Improve Fitness and Arm Health 1 Year Later?

lead_sponsor.agency: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

clinical_study.source: Ohio State University Comprehensive Cancer Center

brief_summary.textblock: This randomized pilot phase I/II trial studies how well aerobic and strength training exercise works in improving fitness and arm health during and after radiation therapy in patients with stage II-III breast cancer. Aerobic and strength training exercise training during and after radiation therapy may reduce treatment related toxicities and improve adherence to exercise long term in patients with breast cancer.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVES:
I. To determine the feasibility of conducting an exercise program during and after radiation therapy and to determine what percent of patients will complete the exercise program. (Pilot) II. To determine the percent increase in fitness as measured by the 6 minute walk test in women receiving radiation therapy for breast cancer randomized to an exercise program at 1 year. (Phase II)
SECONDARY OBJECTIVES:
I. Percent adherence to exercise at 1 year as measured by the International Physical Activity Questionnaire and exercise logs.
II. Subjective arm health at 1 year as measured by Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy Questionnaire for Breast Cancer version 4 (FACT-B+4).
III. Arm lymphedema at 1 year as measured by arm circumference. IV. Arm range of motion at 1 year as measured by goniometry. V. Quality of life at 1 year as measured by FACT-B+4. VI. Percent increase in arm strength as measured by one repetition maximum at 1 year.
VII. Change in weight and body mass index (BMI) 1 year after completion of radiation.
OUTLINE: Patients are randomized to 1 of 2 arms.
ARM I: Patients receive usual care for 6 weeks during radiation therapy and for 12 weeks after completion of radiation therapy.
ARM II: Patients undergo a supervised aerobic and strength training exercise session over 40-60 minutes 3 times weekly for 6 weeks during radiation therapy and for 12 weeks after completion of radiation therapy.
After completion of study, patients are followed up at 1 and 6 months, and 1 year.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants who complete 70% of all exercise sessions throughout the supervised program during and after radiation therapy (Pilot) based on collected exercise logs
primary_outcome.description: determine the feasibility of conducting an exercise program during and after radiation therapy and to determine what percent of patients will complete the exercise program.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent increase in fitness as measured by the 6 minute walk test in patients randomized to exercise program (Phase II)
primary_outcome.description: Will be compared to usual care group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Arm lymphedema as measured by arm circumference
secondary_outcome.description: Generalized linear models will be utilized to model follow-up as a function of baseline and group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Arm range of motion as measured by goniometry
secondary_outcome.description: Generalized linear models will be utilized to model follow-up as a function of baseline and group.

Generalized linear models will be utilized to model follow-up as a function of baseline and group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent adherence to exercise as measured by the International Physical Activity Questionnaire and exercise logs
secondary_outcome.description: Generalized linear models will be utilized to model follow-up as a function of baseline and group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent increase in arm strength as measured by one repetition maximum
secondary_outcome.description: Generalized linear models will be utilized to model follow-up as a function of baseline and group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life as measured by FACT-B+4
secondary_outcome.description: Cronbach's alpha will be calculated to show consistency prior to combining the Likert items. Generalized linear models will be utilized to model follow-up as a function of baseline and group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective arm health as measured by FACT-B+4
secondary_outcome.description: Cronbach's alpha will be calculated to show consistency prior to combining the Likert items. Generalized linear models will be utilized to model follow-up as a function of baseline and group.

arm_group.description: Patients undergo a supervised aerobic and strength training exercise session over 40-60 minutes 3 times weekly for 6 weeks during radiation therapy and for 12 weeks after completion of radiation therapy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stage II-III breast cancer
- Prior surgery including lumpectomy or mastectomy and sentinel node biopsy or axillary lymph node dissection
- Prior chemotherapy in the neoadjuvant or adjuvant setting
- Radiation plan consisting of regional nodal radiation
- Must be suitable for an exercise program
Exclusion Criteria:
- Serious underlying medical comorbidity such as uncontrolled hypertension, cardiovascular disease, pulmonary disease, psychiatric illness, or any other condition for which the patient is not approved for exercise by their physician
- Physical handicap that would prevent participation in program
- Patients with metastatic breast cancer
